title: Changing how we talk — and think — about manufacturing - University of Cambridge news
summary: The article emphasizes the need for a comprehensive and connected approach to manufacturing, combining technologies, skills, and supply chains to drive economic growth, environmental sustainability, and resilience.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses the importance of developing technologies, skills, and supply chains to enhance environmental sustainability, which aligns with the concept of green innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article highlights the importance of transformative change in manufacturing processes and practices, indicating a shift towards new or improved business processes to drive efficiency and sustainability.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not focus on a specific product, but rather on the broader strategies and approaches within the manufacturing sector.
green_process: TRUE. The article emphasizes the adoption of technologies and practices that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability in manufacturing processes, aligning with the concept of green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 31-33 (Manufacturing), 54 (Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services), 62 (Health Care and Social Assistance), 72 (Accommodation and Food Services)
greenwashing: FALSE. The article focuses on promoting genuine efforts to enhance sustainability in manufacturing practices rather than misleading environmental claims.
